mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter Regarding Civil War Era Steel Engravings
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A letter written by Mrs. Maude L. Howard inquiring about the possible value and sale of a collection of Civil War era Steel Engraved Photographs. She explains that her husband (who was Dr. Thomas Henry Howard,) was a surgeon in the army and found them after the battle of Gettysburg. She lists the following steel engravings in her possession: "Abraham Lincoln - Engraved for the rebellion record S.A. Douglas - Engraved by M.B. Brady Williams H. Seward - Engraved by J.P. Buttre Edward Everette - Engraved by J.P. Buttre Robert Anderson, Brigadier General U.S.A. Winfield Scott, Lieutenant General L.L. - Engraved by H.B. Hall Rosecrans, Brigadier General - Engraved for the rebellion H. Hamlin and others..
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Doctors

Records (Information)
